resources.string: Tap Lock uses NFC and Bluetooth to lock and unlock PCs.\u000A\u000ACurrently, Gnome Desktop on Linux is supported.\u000A\u000ASetup:\u000A\u000A1. Install Java 1.5\u002B on the PC\u000A2. Copy the TapLockServer.jar file to the PC using one of the \u0022Get the TapLockServer.jar\u0022 options.\u000A3. Configure the Tap Lock Server to start at login on the PC using these examples\u003A\u000A\u000Ajava -jar \u002Fhome\u002Fuser\u002FTapLockServer\u002FTapLockServer.jar \u003E\u002Fdev\u002Fnull 2\u003E\u00261\u000A\u000Ajava -jar C\u003A\u005CUsers\u005Cuser\u005CTapLockServer\u005CTapLockServer.jar\u000A\u000A4. Make sure that Bluetooth is enabled on the PC and that the Tap Lock Server is running\u000A5. In the Tap Lock app, on the Android device, press Add device to setup the PC\u000A6. After pairing with the PC, select that newly added device for further options.\u000A\u000ADevices can be toggled by launching a URI or URL from Tasker or NFC Task Launcher using the format taplock\u003A\u002F\u002Fdevicename\u000A\u000AOn Windows, you can run the following command, updated for the installation path, to start the Tap Lock Server at logon.\u000A\u000Aecho java -jar \u0025USERPROFILE\u0025\u005CTapLockServer\u005CTapLockServer.jar > \u0022\u0025USERPROFILE\u0025\u005CAppData\u005CRoaming\u005CMicrosoft\u005CWindows\u005CStart Menu\u005CPrograms\u005CStartup\u005CstartTapLockServer.bat\u0022

Configure the Tap Lock Server to start at login on the PC using these examples\u003A\u000A\u000Ajava -jar \u002Fhome\u002Fuser\u002FTapLockServer\u002FTapLockServer.jar \u003E\u002Fdev\u002Fnull 2\u003E\u00261\u000A\u000Ajava -jar C\u003A\u005CUsers\u005Cuser\u005CTapLockServer\u005CTapLockServer.jar\u000A\u000A4. Make sure that Bluetooth is enabled on the PC and that the Tap Lock Server is running\u000A5. In the Tap Lock app, on the Android device, press Add device to setup the PC\u000A6. After pairing with the PC, select that newly added device for further options.\u000A\u000ADevices can be toggled by launching a URI or URL from Tasker or NFC Task Launcher using the format taplock\u003A\u002F\u002Fdevicename\u000A\u000AOn Windows, you can run the following command, updated for the installation path, to start the Tap Lock Server at logon.\u000A\u000Aecho java -jar \u0025USERPROFILE\u0025\u005CTapLockServer\u005CTapLockServer.jar > \u0022\u0025USERPROFILE\u0025\u005CAppData\u005CRoaming\u005CMicrosoft\u005CWindows\u005CStart Menu\u005CPrograms\u005CStartup\u005CstartTapLockServer.bat\u0022

First, setup the TapLockServer on a PC using the instructions in the menu option ABOUT. Next, add that PC as a device using the menu option ADD DEVICE.
Long press on devices for additional options, including changing the passphrase.
The sdcard is not available. Is it inserted?
